about_the_game:
Hana card, also known as Hanazono, originated as a 48-piece of card game in Portugal and later spread to Japan. The game evolved over generations in Japan, and eventually became the current Hanazashi game in the late Edo period. Generals of cards borrowed from this kind of play and extended on this basis.

【Hana card】Trigger through Tarven NPC


There were many of famous generals ditributed in domains. There will be 12 forces and 4 generals in each force, sum up to 48 cards in the game.
Both sides will get 8 cards randomly, and 8 cards in neutral zone. If either side appears one force card as the same as the card in neutral zone, then the side will get the card; however, if there are two or above the same force cards, only one can be choosed. After choosing, one card in deck should be sent to neutral zone; if there still is the same force card shown in this time, the side can get the card from neutral zone; otherwise, the card shown from deck should be sent to neutral zone.

【Hana card】Rules of game


According to the card got from neutral zone, settled combination can be formed, and each of combination has their own points. Activating the combination will lead to settle point and end the game; or yield the settlement to obtain more combinations; however, the next settlement needs a new combination activaction, after giving up. A draw occurs when both sides have not settled their hands.

【Hana card】Scores of combination


A brand-new Three Kingdoms time and competition among domains, are you ready for a good victory?

【Hana card】Main interface
